title.narrative: Scaling CSA through investment in resilience of coffee production

description.narrative: STIR UP Coffee focuses on climate-smart coffee production. This initiative, accelerates the BACK to REDD+ (B2R) model in Mexico and Central America which has, to date, seen considerable success increasing income and food security, farmer efficiency and resilience among farmers. The Comon Yaj Noptic cooperative in Mexico has become our climate-smart coffee laboratory from where we collect evidence to promote and upscale this coffee production model to Nicaragua and Honduras. Past years’ piloting showed that farmers in Mexico increased yields threefold, and carbon sequestration increased 14% as a result of the introduction of rust-free genetic material, increasing the planting density and improving the nutrient application. We shared these results in the Nicaraguan Sustainable Coffee Platform (NICAFES), to encourage upscaling in Nicaragua. We have initiated new partnerships with Mercon, Illy and FARM-TRACE (a Canadian based company that catalyze investments into natural climate solutions) to introduce the climate-smart coffee model, train their technical team, and carry out the local adaptation and testing of digital tools (FARM-TRACE and Cool Farm Tool) with a small sample of producers. These case studies aim to create a replicable model for the coffee brands to invest in the incorporation of these practices in their supply chains, in order to reduce their carbon footprint and improve farmers' income. In Honduras, the climate-smart coffee model was shared through the Sustainable Coffee Platform (supported by Advocacy for Change programme) with the stakeholders of the sector. As a result, we started to implement a pilot to reduce the greenhouse gases emissions through biodigesters, and the test effluent management strategies.

comment.narrative: The 100% of producers that are implementing CSA, increase their income. The goal was not reached because at the moment the commitment of financial actors to scale the CSA model has not been achieved. However, there is currently a proposal with Starbucks and Louis Dreyfus to scale the model.

title.narrative: # of farmers/miners/workers (m/f) trained to adopt good practices

comment.narrative: 68 direct + 79 indirect producers and 3 technicians. The project strategy and the model developed is based on the investment opportunity of organizations and companies. We have only had one investment from the CYNT (Producer organization) so far. The goal was not reached because at the moment the commitment of financial actors to scale the CSA model has not been achieved. However, there is currently a proposal with Starbucks and Louis Dreyfus to scale the model.
